posts.raw_content:
Sarah Ashton-Cirillo, an American transgender woman and former spokesperson for Ukraine's Territorial Defense Forces (TDF), who in September 2023 vowed to "hunt down" Russian propagandists.                                                        
                                                                                                                                            
The Threat: In a video message, Ashton-Cirillo stated that "the world will see a favorite Kremlin propagandist pay for their crimes," adding, "And this puppet of Putin is only the first". The comments were widely interpreted as a threat of physical violence or assassination against pro-Russian media figures.                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                        
Target Identification: The threat did not name specific U.S. media figures at the time, but some American conservative commentators, such as Charlie Kirk and Senator J.D. Vance, claimed that critics of U.S. policy in Ukraine were being targeted or slandered as propagandists.
Consequences: The comments led to significant controversy, particularly in the United States, where Senator J.D. Vance formally complained, expressing worry that American resources might be supporting violence against individuals for protected speech.
Suspension and Firing: Following the backlash, the Ukrainian military suspended Ashton-Cirillo pending an investigation, stating that her comments were not approved by the command of the TDF or the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Reports indicated she was subsequently dismissed from her role.                                                                                                                    
                                                                                                                                           
Ashton-Cirillo's Stance: Ashton-Cirillo defended her position by arguing that Russian propagandists are not journalists but "information agents" and an "extension of the Putin-Prigozhin effort to spread chaos". She also noted that she faced transphobic attacks in Russian media.
Russian Response: In response to her actions and her role in the Ukrainian military, Russian authorities in 2025 sentenced Ashton-Cirillo in absentia to 20 years in prison on charges of spreading "false information" about the Russian Armed Forces and participating as a mercenary. Russia also added her to a "terrorist" wanted list.
posts.author: Rosebud4Jesus
posts.title: Ukraine involved with Kirk Assassination?  Remember transgender Sarah Ashton-Cirillo, Spokesperson for Ukraine's Territorial Defense Forces who in Sept 2023 vowed to "hunt down" USA Russian propagandists conservative commentators. Charlie took this as a direct threat on his life.
posts.content:
Sarah Ashton-Cirillo, an American transgender woman and former spokesperson for Ukraine's Territorial Defense Forces (TDF), who in September 2023 vowed to "hunt down" Russian propagandists.

The Threat: In a video message, Ashton-Cirillo stated that "the world will see a favorite Kremlin propagandist pay for their crimes," adding, "And this puppet of Putin is only the first". The comments were widely interpreted as a threat of physical violence or assassination against pro-Russian media figures.

Target Identification: The threat did not name specific U.S. media figures at the time, but some American conservative commentators, such as Charlie Kirk and Senator J.D. Vance, claimed that critics of U.S. policy in Ukraine were being targeted or slandered as propagandists. Consequences: The comments led to significant controversy, particularly in the United States, where Senator J.D. Vance formally complained, expressing worry that American resources might be supporting violence against individuals for protected speech. Suspension and Firing: Following the backlash, the Ukrainian military suspended Ashton-Cirillo pending an investigation, stating that her comments were not approved by the command of the TDF or the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Reports indicated she was subsequently dismissed from her role.

Ashton-Cirillo's Stance: Ashton-Cirillo defended her position by arguing that Russian propagandists are not journalists but "information agents" and an "extension of the Putin-Prigozhin effort to spread chaos". She also noted that she faced transphobic attacks in Russian media. Russian Response: In response to her actions and her role in the Ukrainian military, Russian authorities in 2025 sentenced Ashton-Cirillo in absentia to 20 years in prison on charges of spreading "false information" about the Russian Armed Forces and participating as a mercenary. Russia also added her to a "terrorist" wanted list.
